name: titration
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
chemistry
  specialized a method or the activity of finding exactly how much of a substance there is in a solution by gradually adding measured amounts of another substance that reacts to it in a known way, for example by causing a colour change: The acid content of the gastric juice was determined by titration to pH 7.4 with NaOH. We described above the titration procedure for determining the amount of acid required to neutralize an alkali. In the practical session we tackled about ten titrations each in three hours.
medical
  specialized the act of calculating and, if necessary, changing how much of a drug, etc. is given to a patient in order to produce the best result, without causing too many side effects (= unpleasant effects that happen in addition to the main intended effect): Despite careful titration of sedative doses, individual patient responses are variable. Too rapid titration for the patient’s sensitivity may produce adverse effects. Insulin acts rapidly and responds quickly to dose titrations.
